src:
SEA Games 2019: Timnas Hoki Indoor Latihan di Republik Cek
06 Nov 2019, 15:58 by Tempo.co, Ariandono
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Timnas hoki indoor putra dan putri Indonesia akan memanfatkan trainning camp (TC) dan try out ke Republik Cek selama 16 hari untuk menimba ilmu sekaligus mematangkan pola permainan yang diterapkan pelatih Iran, Yaghoub Bahrami dalam rangka mewujudkan target satu medali emas pada SEA Games 2019 yang digelar di Filipina, 30 November hingga 11 Desember 2019.
"Kami sangat berterima kasih atas kesempatan yang diberikan pemerintah dalam hal ini Kemenpora untuk menjalani TC dan try out di Republik Cek. Dan, kami akan memanfaafkan peluang ini untuk lebih mematangkan pola permainan yang diterapkan pelatih Iran sehingga bisa mewujudkan keinginan untuk menyumbangkan medali emas," kata Kapten timnas hoki putra Indonesia, Daarul Quthni dalam rilis PP FHI, Rabu
Hal senada dilontarkan kapten timnas hoki indoor putri, Annur Amalia El Islamy. "Ya, kami akan memanfaatkan waktu TC dan Try Out untuk menambah pengalaman dan jam terbang laga internasional di sana. Dan, kami akan mengevaluasi kekurangan untuk menghadapi persaingan ketat di Filipina nanti," ujar Annur Amalia El Islamy.
Daarul Quthni dan kawan-kawan serta Annur Amalia dan kawan-kawan memang akan menghadapi persaingan ketat menghadapi tim unggulan Thailand dan Malaysia. Apalagi, timnas putri Thailand menduduki peringkat dua Asia sedangkan timnas putra Malaysia menduduki peringkat ketiga Asia.
Pada SEA Games 2017 Kuala Lumpur, timnas hoki putra Indonesia meraih perak setelah di final kalah dari Malaysia dan timnas hoki putri Indonesia juga meraih perak setelah dikalahkan Thailand.
"Peluang Timnas Hoki Indonesia untuk merebut medali emas cukup terbuka. Pasalnya, mereka punya keunggulan dalam kecepatan serta teknk dasar bermain hoki indoor," kata video analis dari Singapura, Harun Al Rasyid yang ikut bersama rombongan ke Republik Cek.
Pria lulusan Sport Science Cowan University Perth, Australia ini saat menjadi pelatih kepala Kuala Lumpur Hoki Club (KLHC) sukses menjuarai Liga Profesional Hoki Malaysia 2017.
Dalam timnas hoki Indonesia, Harun Al Rasyid bertugas menganalisis setiap pertandingan Timnas Hoki Indonesia maupun lawan-lawan yang bakal dihadapi. Dan, dia memberikan analisis setiap pertandingan yang sudah dilalui maupun yang akan dijalani.
"Thailand dan Malaysia memang menjadi lawan berat Indonesia di Filipina nanti. Namun, peluang untuk mengalahkannya tetap terbuka," tegasnya.
Mengenai TC dan try out di Republik Cek, kata Harun Al Rasyid, sangat membantu untuk lebih meningkatkan kerja sama tim apalagi tim asuhan pelatih Iran itu diterjunkan dalam even internasional.
"Mereka memang butuh menambah pengalaman bertanding internasional dengan lawan yang kualitasnya di atas. Jadi, mereka bisa banyak belajar untuk bisa tampil lebih baik lagi dan mewujudkan keinginan meraih medali emas," ungkapnya.
Sementara itu, Sekjen PP FHI, Yasser Arafat Suaidy meminta seluruh atlet hoki Indonesia fokus selama menjalani TC dan try out selama berada di Republik Cek.
"Manfaatkan kesempatan TC dan try out yang difasilitasi Kemenpora sebaik mungkin. Fokus dalam latihan dan setiap menjalani pertandingan. Tingkatkan kerja sama dalam permainan sehingga keinginan untuk menyumbangkan medali emas bagi Kontingen Indonesia bisa terwujud di Filipina nanti," ujarnya.
Yasser juga meminta Daarul Quthni dan kawan-kawan mempelajari teknik-teknik permainan lawan dalam pertandingan nanti. Begitu juga saat menjalani uji coba dengan Timnas hoki Republik Cek.
Susunan Tim Hoki Indoor Indonesia : PUTRA : Manajer Tim : Mayjen TNI RoediantoPelatih Kepala : Yaghoub BahramiAss. Pelatih : Ahriandi Gusmana dan Irwan HermawanVideo Analis : Harun Al Rasyid Atlet : 1. Ahdan Asasi Ramadhan Uno, 2. Ahmad Fikri Nur Hikmat, 3. Alvin Nourul Saepul Mimbar, 4. Andrea Guntara Adivery Sandrea, 5. Astri Rahmad, 6. Candra Juli Prawesti, 7. Daarul Quthni (C), 8. Fahmi Hidayatullah, 9. Fajar Jaelani Nugraha, 10. Ferdian Fathur Rahman, 11. Iskandar Zulkarnaen, 12. Muhamad Alfiana, 13. Prima Rinaldi Santoso, 14. Revo Priliandro, dan 15. Tomi Efendi. PUTRI : Manajer Tim : Dwi Jati UtomoPelatih Kepala : Yaghoub BahramiAss. Pelatih : Dadan Moh. Ramdani dan Sisworo AriwibowoVideo Analis : Harun Al Rasyid Atlet : 1. Ai Melis Kusmiati, 2. Annur Amalia El Islamy (C), 3. Ardita Maulidah, 4. Aulia Ghassani Putri Arindah, 5. Citra Purbasari, 6. Nuraini Sugiarti, 7. Olevia Kbarek, 8. Patmawati, 9. Rahma Dwi Aulia, 10. Selly Amalia Florentina, 11. Sarah Amaniah, 12. Rwede Sabatine Tamar Sawor, 13. Zulita Dwi Aprilia, 14. Putri Krismonita, dan 15. Rayhan Jannatain Ainani Uno.
text:
SEA Games 2019: Indoor Hockey Team National Training in Czech Republic
Nov 6 2019, 15:58 by Tempo.co, Ariandono
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Indonesian men's and women's indoor hockey team will take advantage of the trainning camp (TC) and try out to check the Republic for 16 days to gain knowledge while finalizing the game patterns applied by Iranian coach, Yaghoub Bahrami in order to realize the target of one gold medal at the 2019 SEA Games held in the Philippines, 30 November to 11 December 2019.
"We are very grateful for the opportunity given by the government in this case the Ministry of Youth and Sports to undergo TCs and try outs in the Czech Republic. And, we will take advantage of this opportunity to further finalize the pattern of play adopted by the Iranian coach so that he can realize the desire to donate a gold medal," said the captain of the Indonesian men's hockey national team, Daarul Quthni in a PP FHI release on Wednesday
The same thing was said by the captain of the women's indoor hockey national team, Annur Amalia El Islamy. "Yes, we will use TC time and Try Out to add experience and flying hours of international matches there. And, we will evaluate the shortcomings to face fierce competition in the Philippines later," said Annur Amalia El Islamy.
Daarul Quthni and his friends as well as Annur Amalia and friends will indeed face stiff competition against leading teams from Thailand and Malaysia. Moreover, Thailand women's national team was ranked second in Asia while Malaysian men's national team was ranked third in Asia.
At the SEA Games 2017 Kuala Lumpur, the Indonesian men's hockey national team won silver after losing in Malaysia to the final and the Indonesian women's hockey national team also won silver after losing to Thailand.
"The opportunity of the Indonesian Hockey National Team to win the gold medal is quite open. The reason is, they have the advantage in speed and basic technique of playing indoor hockey," said video analyst from Singapore, Harun Al Rasyid who joined the group in the Republic of Cek.
The man who graduated from Sport Science at Cowan University in Perth, Australia, when he became the head coach of the Kuala Lumpur Hoki Club (KLHC) successfully won the Malaysia Hockey Professional League 2017.
In the Indonesian hockey national team, Harun Al Rasyid is tasked with analyzing every match of the Indonesian Hockey National Team and opponents that will be faced. And, he gives an analysis of every game that has been passed and will be lived.
"Thailand and Malaysia are indeed tough opponents of Indonesia in the Philippines. However, the opportunity to defeat them remains open," he said.
Regarding TCs and try outs in the Czech Republic, said Harun Al Rasyid, it was very helpful to further enhance teamwork especially that the Iranian coach's care team was deployed in international events.
"They really need to add experience of international competition with opponents whose quality is above. So, they can learn a lot to be able to perform better and realize the desire to win a gold medal," he said.
Meanwhile, Secretary General of PP FHI, Yasser Arafat Suaidy asked all Indonesian hockey athletes to focus while undergoing TCs and try out while in the Czech Republic.
"Take advantage of TC opportunities and try outs facilitated by the Ministry of Youth and Sports as much as possible. Focus on training and every game. Increase cooperation in the game so that the desire to donate a gold medal for the Indonesian contingent can be realized in the Philippines later," he said.
Yasser also asked Daarul Quthni and his friends to learn the techniques of the opponent's game in the match later. Likewise when undergoing trials with the Czech Republic national hockey team.
